title: 103_s420
content: Ethics in Government Reform Act of 1993 - Codifies in the Federal criminal code the lobbying restrictions on senior executive branch appointees under Executive Order 12834, generally and with certain technical changes and extends those restrictions to the Vice President, Members of Congress, and highly paid staffers. Prohibits the President, Vice President, Members of Congress, Federal Reserve Board Governors, and certain other Federal officials from receiving anything of value from a foreign government after their service or employment ends.
